release.action: Updating "maven-reporting-impl" to 2.0.4 to avoid problems during site deployment (multiple instances of commons-logging detected which causes the upload to fail).
Updating ASL headers to make CheckStyle happy.
Cleaning up pom.xml to get rid of redundant plugin definitions

The R_1810 webtest release creates the HTML report pages on the fly using an Ant macrodef. Since we don't have this macro the execution fails. Added 'resultreporterclass' to configure/disable the behaviour.
A problem forced update to R_1810 which is not found in any M2 repo. Going back to include the webtest classes into the plugin to have more flexibility.
Fixed NPE when putting 'null' as property value.

The webtest configuration properties can be now overwritten on the command line, e.g. "-Dwebtest.target=foo". Please note that work currently only for properties which are not defined in the pom.xml (seems to be a M2 problem).
Maven properties can now be passed to the Canoo Webtest script and additionally prefixed. Added another integration tes (it11) to show how the property passing works.
Tweaked the code to avoid "import requires support in ProjectHelper" as described in the Ant user mailing list.
Updating the documentation.
Moving the plugin to Mojo Sandbox.
Setting UTF-8 encoding for code and resources in pom.xml.
Updated the plugin documentation and added one more integration test (it9) to show binding the plugin to different life cycle phases.
Syncing resources with Canoo WebTest 3.0.
Added the PDF test (it8) as described in Felipe Gaucho's blog (http://weblogs.java.net/blog/felipegaucho/archive/2009/11/18/testing-pdf-files-canoo-webtest-and-maven2).
Added more information what the integration tests are doing.
Upgrading to HTMLUnit 2.6 to fix a known Javascript problem.

Upgrading to the official Canoo WebTest 3.0 release which is now available via maven repository. The WebTest code does no longer have to be included in the plugin which simplifies the build and reduces the plugin size.
Upgrading to the latest Canoo WebTest R1720 build. This also implies that the plugin requires JDK 1.5 to run.
Added 'it7' integration test to cover Google Javascript handling
Updated the usage section of the plugin documentation.
Upgrading to the official Canoo WebTest 2.6 release.
Added the goal 'webtest:verify-filecontent'
The goal 'webtest:verify' was renamed to 'webtest:verify-result' to avoid name clashes.
Added webtest:clean target
Removed the custom dependencies found in lib - this caused a build failure when installing the plugin.
Added CCWebTestReport.xsl to tinker with better CruiseControl integration
Added webtest:verify to enforce a 'BUILD FAILURE' even when haltonfailure and haltonerror are false. Using this setting the build would report SUCCESS even when all tests are broken.
Added CCWebTestReport.xsl to tinker with better CruiseControl integration
Added maven classpath references for use inside Ant scripts.
Unpacking the non-public jars into target/classes - this simplifies shipping the plugin
Using javax.mail-1.4 from the maven repo
Added a README.txt
Keeping the plugin parameters to lowercase to avoid upper/lowercase clashes.
Better error handling when catching an exception.
Using the artifactId as report title.
Removing the DOCTYPE from "WebTestReport.xsl" to get rid of Xalan's validation warnings.
Keeping the plugin parameters to lowercase to avoid upper/lowercase clashes.
Better error handling when catching an exception.
Initial release to the public.
